6294b6cc-cf6a-45b8-904c-adb2a07f1115.description: This credential has been awarded to those who have participated in our competition-based training programme. In taking part in this programme there has been a commitment to developing technical, employability and personal skills to a high standard using benchmarked assessments, leading to higher skills development. At each stage of the competition activity there has been personal and professional growth as well as developing skills, knowledge and behaviours in vocational and technical education.
6294b6cc-cf6a-45b8-904c-adb2a07f1115.name: National Competitions: National Qualifiers Competitor

badge_template_activities.title: Taking part in a national qualifier (up to 7 hours)

fdf855b5-fc54-4080-bf56-189aca74f0a3.description: Awarded to educators who have participated in WorldSkills UK’s Developing Excellence in Teaching and Training CPD event. The event draws on learnings from a global network, to help educators understand and embed world-class practices, learn more about the latest advances in learning technology, and examine how to support those from underrepresented groups. Developed in partnership with The Education and Training Foundation.
fdf855b5-fc54-4080-bf56-189aca74f0a3.name: Developing Excellence in Teaching and Training

badge_template_activities.title: Educators are introduced to methodologies developed from national and international best practice to support the highest possible standards of teaching, training, and assessment; providing educators with the motivation and confidence to apply world-class practices and supporting quality improvement across further and technical education.

Educators explore the concept of social constructs and how this can contribute to unequal opportunities for underrepresented groups. This session maps out ways to support underrepresented groups to increase representation in TVET.
Educators learn the latest advances in learning technology and its practical application in further and technical education, and how to build them into day-to-day practice.

dde803b7-836f-4dba-9309-be1115c6c13f.description: This credential has been awarded to those who have participated in our competition-based training programme. In taking part in this programme there has been a commitment to developing technical, employability and personal skills to a high standard using benchmarked assessments, leading to higher skills development. At each stage of the competition activity there has been personal and professional growth as well as developing skills, knowledge and behaviours in vocational and technical education.
dde803b7-836f-4dba-9309-be1115c6c13f.name: National Competitions: Passive Stage Competitor

badge_template_activities.title: Taking part in a passive test (up to 4 hours)

f9f2c1ef-da27-4d8b-b199-60402b6b0297.description: This credential has been awarded to educators who have successfully completed the Developing Skills Excellence CPD programme as part of the WorldSkills UK Centre of Excellence, delivered in partnership with NCFE. Completing the 10-day endorsed CPD and continuing to cascade their learning to learners and peers within their institutions is a demonstration of a commitment to driving excellence in teaching and training, through continuous professional development (CPD).
f9f2c1ef-da27-4d8b-b199-60402b6b0297.name: Developing Skills Excellence CPD

badge_template_activities.title: The CPD has been facilitated through online learning, practical workshops, and discussions, to develop a range of skills and methods allowing educators to: embed excellence and international best practice into teaching practice; provide training to their peers on developing skills excellence and raise standards in learners, moving them from competence to excellence.

The CPD has been facilitated through online learning, practical workshops, and discussions, to develop a range of skills and methods allowing educators to: embed excellence and international best practice into teaching practice; provide training to their peers on developing skills excellence and raise standards in learners, moving them from competence to excellence.

skills.name: Embedding Lean principles into education delivery
Nurturing high performance attributes in learners
Raising Standards in Technical and Vocational Education

711a4104-969b-41f9-bb8b-76acbb694374.description: Awarded to students and apprentices who have successfully completed the Mindset Masterclass programme through the WorldSkills UK Learning Lab. Mindset Masterclasses are an evidence-based approach to understand and learn the ten skills (Psychological Characteristics of Developing Excellence) to optimise performance in education, work and life.
711a4104-969b-41f9-bb8b-76acbb694374.name: Mindset Masterclass

badge_template_activities.title: Understand a range of techniques that positively support them in their life.
Learn how to better cope under pressure.
Learners will be more inspired and motivated to achieve their potential.
Develop invaluable transferable skills that will help them into employment.

19593053-597b-4caa-b64e-9c4bf1bbfbf5.description: Awarded to students and apprentices who have successfully completed a Technical Masterclass through the WorldSkills UK Learning Lab. The Technical Masterclass develops fundamental and critical skills in learners informed by global standards of vocational excellence. Designed to develop occupational expertise and transferable skills like problem solving and critical reflection to meet the needs of employers.
19593053-597b-4caa-b64e-9c4bf1bbfbf5.name: Technical Skills Masterclass

badge_template_activities.title: Learners are introduced to new skills to carry out tasks to high standards of technical excellence and quality.
Learners understand the process of lean principles and be able to demonstrate the importance of improving efficiency, waste management and work organisation.
Learners will develop practical problem-solving skills and critical reflection on experience, including learning from mistakes.
Learners are introduced to the practices adopted by Squad and Team UK who represent their country and nation on a global stage at the biennial skills olympics.
Learners are exposed to world-class standards of excellence through the WorldSkills Occupational Standards.

c810f5fd-9cbd-4924-9897-91c5366452c7.description: Awarded to educators who have successfully completed the Embedding Skills Competitions CPD through the WorldSkills UK Learning Lab. Drawing on examples of best practice to embed competition-based practices in teaching and learning to enrich curriculum delivery to raise learner aspirations and outcomes.
c810f5fd-9cbd-4924-9897-91c5366452c7.name: Embedding Skills Competitions

badge_template_activities.title: Educators gain an insight into the benefits from embedding competition activities .
Educators learn the steps needed to apply competition activity within their institution to successfully achieve an ‘embedded and well-established’ competition model.
Educators explore practical case studies to learn about successful educators and institutions that have achieved world-class standards.
Educators learn how to support their education inspection frameworks by offering this innovative solution to improve the quality of education.

74a0fce8-13d2-4f79-91a0-7bff19adcfe9.description: This credential is awarded to members of Squad UK who have undergone intensive technical and skills development training as part of the WorldSkills UK international competition-based training programme, to be selected to represent the United Kingdom in the ‘skills olympics’ for WorldSkills 2022. Members of Squad UK are highly employable, resilient, skilled, and agile young professionals who have demonstrated a high-level of commitment in pursuit of skills excellence in their chosen field.
74a0fce8-13d2-4f79-91a0-7bff19adcfe9.name: Squad UK 2022

badge_template_activities.title: The individual has met the world-class standards set at each stage of their journey: National competitions
The individual has met the world-class standards set at each stage of their journey: International competitions
The individual has met the world-class standards set at each stage of their journey: WorldSkills
The individual has met the world-class standards set at each stage of their journey: WorldSkills UK

7302ee2f-da02-4431-acf3-d689c71a3387.description: Awarded to educators who have successfully completed the Coaching for High Performance CPD programme through the WorldSkills UK Learning Lab. The CPD draws on approaches used by coaches and educators across high performance domains to build on existing skills and supercharge their approach to teaching and training. The CPD is designed in partnership with Grey Matters.
7302ee2f-da02-4431-acf3-d689c71a3387.name: Coaching for High Performance CPD

badge_template_activities.title: Educators develop coaching and mentoring approaches designed to support learners to become more reflective, resilient, and innovative in achieving their own goals and targets.
Educators reflect on your own teaching practice and identify opportunities to be more impactful across a wider range of learners.
Educators recognise how to apply the principles of the Psychological Characteristics of Developing Excellence (PCDE) to inspire and motivate learners to achieve their potential.
Educators are introduced to the practices adopted by Training Managers developing a Squad of young people who represent UK on a global stage at the biennial skills olympics.

8604599a-b94f-4b54-b9e7-05c40d969e4b.description: This credential has been awarded to educators who have successfully completed the Developing Skills Excellence - knowledge and skills cascade CPD which is part of the WorldSkills UK Centre of Excellence, delivered in partnership with NCFE. Completing activities covering the WorldSkills UK 7-step methodology, delivered by their peers, who have taken part in the Developing Skills Excellence CPD programme, is a demonstration of commitment to driving excellence in teaching and training, through CPD
8604599a-b94f-4b54-b9e7-05c40d969e4b.name: Developing Skills Excellence - knowledge and skills cascade CPD

badge_template_activities.title: Through engagement in practical workshops, and discussions to explore subjects including the use of pressure testing, mindset training, LEAN principles, and the value of benchmarking to raise standards in learners, moving them from competence to excellence, the CPD programme has provided the educator with a range of skills and methods to embed skills excellence into their teaching practice.

skills.name: Raised awareness of the use of Lean principles in education
Raising Standards in Technical and Vocational Education
Understanding of core and higher order competences
Understanding psychological characteristics of developing excellence (PCDEs)
Understanding the movement of learners from competence to excellence

8adab9df-cdc3-47f9-b8e2-8323c86f14ba.description: Awarded to educators who have successfully completed the Moving from Competence to Excellence CPD through the WorldSkills UK Learning Lab. The CPD introduces WorldSkills UK Developing Excellence Framework that underpins the methodology for developing technical excellence and occupational expertise in students and apprentices. Developed through the award winning Centre of Excellence in partnership with NCFE.
8adab9df-cdc3-47f9-b8e2-8323c86f14ba.name: Moving from Competence to Excellence CPD

badge_template_activities.title: Educators understand how the 7-step developing excellence framework underpins WorldSkills UK’s training methodology and its transfer into teaching and training.
Educators can explain the process of moving from competence to excellence, through raising standards and the identification of core and higher order competencies.
Educators learn how to embed pressure testing into curriculum delivery to raise standards of learners.
Educators are introduced to the practices adopted by Training Managers developing a Squad of young people who represent UK on a global stage at the biennial skills olympics.
Educators are exposed to world-class standards of excellence through the WorldSkills Occupational Standards.

ed84ee14-27be-47f0-96ee-9cd4c146fbe3.description: This credential is awarded to members of Team UK who have undergone intensive technical and skills development training as part of the WorldSkills UK international competition-based training programme, to be selected to represent the United Kingdom in the ‘skills olympics’ for WorldSkills 2022. Members of Team UK are highly employable, resilient, skilled, and agile young professionals who have demonstrated a high-level of commitment in pursuit of skills excellence in their chosen field.
ed84ee14-27be-47f0-96ee-9cd4c146fbe3.name: Team UK 2022

badge_template_activities.title: The individual has met the world-class standards set at each stage of their journey: National Competitions
The individual has met the world-class standards set at each stage of their journey: International Competitions
The individual has met the world-class standards set at each stage of their journey: WorldSkills
The individual has met the world-class standards set at each stage of their journey: WorldSkills UK

f290cbba-838a-4bd4-9cca-372f6495fc25.description: Awarded to participants who have successfully completed Achieving Excellence in Further and Technical Education hosted by WorldSkills UK in partnership with NCFE. The one-day course is a demonstration of a commitment to driving excellence in teaching and training, through continuous professional development (CPD).
f290cbba-838a-4bd4-9cca-372f6495fc25.name: Achieving Excellence in Further and Technical Education

badge_template_activities.title: Through engagement in practical workshops and discussions to explore subjects including, international best practice, innovation in teaching and learning, world class practices and the value of benchmarking to raise standards in learners. Participants will recognise the competence to excellence pathway and techniques in supporting learners to achieve excellence.

skills.name: Raising Standards in Technical and Vocational Education

cdc60b00-9f88-477e-a60a-c94018553950.description: This credential has been awarded to educators who have participated in the Skills Development Ambassador Programme as part of the World Skills UK Innovation Network. They completed an educator module on the Skills Development Hub and used the Hub with learners to enrich and supplement learning, build confidence and develop personal, professional and technical skills. They have also shown evidence of embedding use of the Skills Development Hub in lesson and curriculum planning.
cdc60b00-9f88-477e-a60a-c94018553950.name: Innovation Network Skills Development Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: Educators have completed an educator module on the Skills Development Hub and used the Hub with learners to enrich and supplement learning, build confidence and develop personal, professional and technical skills. The WorldSkills UK Skills Development Hub is the home of skills excellence hosting free tools and resources to support teachers and trainers to develop themselves and their learners.

57266ee2-10bb-433e-9934-b7ce0cae334d.description: This credential has been awarded to those who have participated in our competition-based training programme. In taking part in this programme there has been a commitment to developing technical, employability and personal skills to a high standard using benchmarked assessments, leading to higher skills development. At each stage of the competition activity there has been personal and professional growth as well as developing skills, knowledge and behaviours in vocational and technical education.
57266ee2-10bb-433e-9934-b7ce0cae334d.name: National Competitions: Finalist

badge_template_activities.title: Taking part in national finals (up to 17 hours)
